title: In-Situ STEM Study of Recrystallization in Amorphous SrTiO3
content: Formation of high quality crystalline complex oxides from their amorphous phases using epitaxial crystallization is highly desirable as it enables incorporation of these films in complex device geometries and microstructures. [1] Solid-phase epitaxy is one such growth mechanism, where the amorphous film deposited on a substrate can crystallize to the underlying template upon heating. [2] SrTiO3 is one such widely studied material system using epitaxy, due to its excellent electronic properties, for device-based applications. [3-6] In this work, in-situ STEM is used to study the recrystallization of amorphous SrTiO3, where changes in the atomic structure are monitored as a function of increasing temperature and annealing, to determine parameters for creating high quality crystalline interfaces.
